resources.string: Enter your username or email and we\'ll send a temporary password to your email.
Enter new username and password, to create a new AMD account.
As long as you\'re connected, the AMD server detects attacks on your phone.
You have confirmed the password incorrectly. please try again.

All rights reserved to Ben Gabay.
Release Date: 12/3/2018


 Android Malwares Detector(AMD), is detecting malwares on your Android device. You have several options after logging in: Stay on the home page, see notifications from the AMD server following malwares found, or change your settings on the settings page. On the Settings page, you can change your username, change your password, change your email, mute notifications from the server, delete your user, or log out. As long as you're signed in, a few checks are made on your device:
- Check all applications that installed on your device.
- Check all the processes running on the device.
- Check all SMS received.
- If you have used the camera services, because you are not allowed to.
- If there are settings that are enabled on your device and may endanger it.
- The OS version of the Android device.

For more questions: ben.gabay38@gmail.com
